resource.name: Trips by Distance
resource.description:
How many people are staying at home? How far are people traveling when they don’t stay home? Which states and counties have more people taking trips? The Bureau of Transportation Statistics (BTS) now provides answers to those questions through our new mobility statistics.

The Trips by Distance data and number of people staying home and not staying home are estimated for the Bureau of Transportation Statistics by the Maryland Transportation Institute and Center for Advanced Transportation Technology Laboratory at the University of Maryland. The travel statistics are produced from an anonymized national panel of mobile device data from multiple sources. All data sources used in the creation of the metrics contain no personal information. Data analysis is conducted at the aggregate national, state, and county levels. A weighting procedure expands the sample of millions of mobile devices, so the results are representative of the entire population in a nation, state, or county. To assure confidentiality and support data quality, no data are reported for a county if it has fewer than 50 devices in the sample on any given day.

Trips are defined as movements that include a stay of longer than 10 minutes at an anonymized location away from home. A movement with multiple stays of longer than 10 minutes before returning home is counted as multiple trips.
resource.attribution: Maryland Transportation Institute and Center for Advanced Transportation Technology Laboratory at the University of Maryland
columns_description: Number of trips by residents greater than 500 miles (trip distance ≥ 500 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than 250 miles and shorter than 500 miles (250 ≤ trip distance < 500 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than 100 miles and shorter than 250 miles (100 ≤ trip distance < 250 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than 50 miles and shorter than 100 miles (50 ≤ trip distance < 100 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than 25 miles and shorter than 50 miles (25 ≤ trip distance < 50 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than 5 miles and shorter than 10 miles (5 ≤ trip distance < 10 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than 3 miles and shorter than 5 miles (3 ≤ trip distance < 5 miles)
Number of trips made by residents, i.e., movements that include a stay of longer than 10 minutes at an anonymized location away from home.
Number of residents staying at home, i.e., persons who make no trips with a trip end more than one mile away from home
Number of trips by residents greater than 10 miles and shorter than 25 miles (10 ≤ trip distance < 25 miles)
Number of trips by residents greater than one mile and shorter than 3 miles (1 ≤ trip distance < 3 miles)
Number of trips by residents shorter than one mile
Number of residents not staying at home
Indicates National, State, or County level metrics
